page.title: 14W.CHILTINGTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The first school was established by an endowment of{William Smyth}in his will of 1634. Comprising two small cottages north of the church, this was in use from 1635 until 1874 by which time it was quite inadquate for the number of children attending. A local house{"Fryars"}accommodated the school until a larger building was erected on the site in 1876. {W.Chiltington County Primary School vacated the building it had occupied for nearly a hundred years in November 1974 to begin a new era in its history in a building of semi-openplan design, providing education for children up to the age of eleven. In a spacious modern building children follow a wide and varied curriculum, which includes the basic subjects as well as {art, music, sport and swimming. The{Smyth Trust}still helps the school
